page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Lying in North Cheshire and nearly midway between Liverpool and Manchester, Lymm is bounded by the {Ship Canal}to the North and the {Bridgewater Canal}to the South. Following the Second World War,Lymm's fields became ever more rapidly covered with private housing estates intended for the car-owning commuter, and the arrival of the Motorway crossroads added to the pressure. Strict planning restrictions in the Green Belt and Conservation Areas are limiting the building of new houses, and warehousing and haulage industries for which Lymm is so attractive a site have been kept at bay.A more recent and less welcome trend is for the smaller shops in the village to be replaced by offices.The Parish Council have now a Retail Trading Policy.
